title: GRE阅读03
content: passage 215W.E.B. Du Bois’ exhibit of African American history and culture at the 1900 Paris Exposition Universelle attracted the attention of a world of sociological scholarship whose value his work challenged. Du Bois believed that Spencerian sociologists failed in their attempts to gain greater understanding of human deeds because their work examined not deeds but theories and because they gathered data not to affect social progress but merely to theorize. in his exhibit. Du Bois sought to present cultural artifacts that would shift the focus of sociology from the construction of vast generalizations to the observation of particular, living individual elements of society and the working contributions of individual people to a vast functioning social structure. The passage implies that Du Bois attributed which of the following beliefs to Spencerian sociologists? A. Theorizing is important to the understanding of human actionsB.Vast generalizations have limited value.C.Data gathering is a relatively unimportant part of sociological researchD.Sociology should focus on the living elements of society rather than cultural artifacts.E.Particulars are more important than universals. A解析：推断题。根据Du Bois和Spencerian sociologists可以定位到原文第二句。本题实质上是考察长难句分析。their (Spencerian sociologists) work examined not deeds but theories and they (Spencerian sociologists) gathered data not to affect social progress but merely to theorize。可知，Spencerian sociologists认为theorizing更重要，综上，A选项正确。B选项错，vast generalization非答案区间。C选项错，relatively unimportant 比较关系的无中生有D选项错，cultural artifacts 非答案区间E选项错，无中生有。 我这个题做错是因为没读懂题目, 题目是问Spencerian sociologist怎么样, 我理解成了Du Bois怎么样.题目翻译: 这段话暗示了杜波依斯将以下哪一种信仰归因于斯宾塞社会学家? For the following question, consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. The passage implies that Du Bois believed which of the following statements about sociology? A. lt should contribute to the betterment of society.B. lt should study what people actually do.C. lt should focus on how existing social structures determine individual behavior. AB解析：可多选题+推断题根据Du Bois 和sociology可以定位到文章最后一句。本题仍然考察长难句分析。本句的核心结构为：shift from A to B and C，B 和 C 所代表的部分即使本题答案。observation of particular, living individual elements of society 可推出B选项正确。working contributions of individual people to a vast functioning social structure 可推出A选项正确。C选项错，无中生有。 lt can be inferred from the passage that Du Bois believed which of the following statements about the artifacts he included in his exhibit? A. They tended to support an established view of African American history and culture.B. They documented the contributions of particular African Americans to American social structure.C. They were chosen to encourage Spencerian sociologists to form useful generalizations. 【新增题目】答案：B解析：本题与第二题的考点有重合，根据最后一句可以选出B选项，AC均属于无中生有。 passage 216Favorable environments do not necessarily lead to the occurrence of plant cultivation. South China is warmer and moister than North China and the Yangtze Basin, with wild rice and highly abundant natural resources. Yet archaeological data indicate that cereal cultivation did not occur in this region until approximately 7,000 to 6,500 years ago. This cultivation was likely a result of cultural contact with and expansion from the Yangtze Basin. Clearly, environmental factors were important for the occurrence of cultivation in China, but were not the absolute determining factors. While incipient cultivation might occur in areas of relatively abundant resources, it may not occur in areas of very abundant resources, such as South China, where foraging might be a more efficient way of life. incipient adj.初期的 forage v.觅食 The author implies which of the following about natural resources in South China prior to 6,500years ago?A. Their abundance may have actually served to discourage the development of plant cultivationB. They were not as abundant as most archaeologists have maintained.C. They led indirectly to cultural contact with peoples from the Yangtze Basin.D. Their importance has been downplayed by scholars studying the beginnings of plant cultivation in South China. 文中完全没有提及 scholars 所以不能选D E. They had little influence on the types of plants that were eventually cultivated in South China A推断题本题利用natural resources in South China进行定位，可以定位到文章第二句和最后一句。此处，做一个说明，虽然题干中有6,500 years，这个比较明显的时间段，但是对于本题的定位并没有任何作用。因为全文就第三句出现了时间，其他地方并没有出现新的时间，说明本文都是在这个时间背景下。当然，如果一开始就定位到第三句，那也能很快发现：情况不对，赶紧撤退。原文最后一句说到，cultivation in South China may not occur,因为foraging might be a more efficient way of life A选项正确。B选项错，as…as 同级比较，无中生有。C选项错，cultural contact非答案区间，出现在第四句。D选项错，been downplayed 无中生有。E选项错，可以从两个方面来理解：一，该选项和A选项矛盾，不可能是little influence;二，influence on the type of plants 无中生有。 Which of the following can be inferred from the passage about plant cultivation in the Yangtze Basin?A. lt occurred in spite of an unfavorable climate.B.lt occurred prior to 6,500 years ago.C. lt occurred somewhat later than it occurred in North China.D. lt occurred largely because of the abundance of wild rice in the region.E.lt occurred as a result of cultural contact with South China. B解析：推断题。利用题干定位到原文2、3、4句。原文说到，cereal cultivation did not occur in this region (South China) until approximately7,000 to 6,500 years ago.同时提到，This cultivation was likely a result of cultural contact with and expansion from the Yangtze Basin.由此，可知YangtzeBasin的cultivation会更早，prior to 6,500 years ago. B选项正确。A、C、D选项，文中无依据。E选项错，因果倒置。This cultivation (SouthChina) was likely a result of cultural contact with and expansion from theYangtze Basin. 而不是相反。 passage 217Wildcats are improbable candidates for domestication. Like all felids cats , wildcats are obligate carnivores, meaning they have a limited metabolic ability to digest anything except proteins. Wildcats live a solitary existence and defend exclusive territories, making them more attached to places than to people. Furthermore, cats do not perform directed tasks and their actual utility is debatable; even as mousers, in this latter role, terrier dogs and ferrets are preferable.Accordingly, there is little reason to believe an early agricultural community would have sought out and selected the wildcat as a house pet. Rather, the best inference is that wildcats exploiting human environments were simply tolerated by people and, over time and space, they gradually diverged from their“wild”relatives. 野猫不太可能被驯化。像所有的猫科动物一样，野猫是专性食肉动物，这意味着它们的代谢能力有限，只能消化蛋白质以外的任何东西。野猫独自生活，保卫自己的领地，这使它们对地方的依恋超过对人的依恋。此外，猫不执行指示任务，它们的实际效用是有争议的;即使作为捕鼠者，在后一种角色中，小猎犬和雪貂更可取。因此，几乎没有理由相信早期的农业社会会寻找并选择野猫作为家庭宠物。相反，最好的推论是，利用人类环境的野猫只是被人类所容忍，随着时间和空间的推移，它们逐渐与它们的“野生”亲戚分道扬镳。 solitary adj. 独自的，单独的 ferret n.雪貂 inference n. 推断，推理 The author would most likely agree that in early agricultural communities cats would have been A. more tolerant than ferrets of contact with humansB. as incapable of performing directed tasks as ferretsC.less likely to be solitary than ferretsD. less useful than terrier dogs at controlling rodentsE.more easily domesticated than terrier dogs D解析：推断题。本题的定位信息并不好使，一是时间，一是cats,而这两个东西贯穿全文，故而本题建议从选项入手。A选项错，该比较无中生有。B选项错，ferrets 是能够preforming directed tasks。C选项错，该比较无中生有。D选项正确，even as mousers, terrier dogsand ferrets are preferable。E选项错，与首句矛盾。 Which of the following best describes the function of the highlighted sentence in the context of the passage as a wholeA. lt challenges a widely accepted theory presented in the passage.B. lt explains a fact that has long puzzled researchers.C.lt draws a conclusion from evidence presented in the passage.D.lt presents new facts in support of a hypothesis.E. lt formulates a new hypothesis from evidence presented in the passage C解析：句子作用题（highlight句是文章倒数第二句）A选项错，高亮句并没有challenge 一个观点。B选项错，long puzzled researchers 无中生有C选项正确。D选项错，高亮句是一个观点，而不是factsE选项错，formulates a new hypothesis无中生有。 passage 200What causes size variation in bumblebee workers? In pollen storing species larvae develop in individual nest cells and are fed directly by adults. Thus, adults probably determine the size attained by each larva. Bumblebee larval cells are not as neatly organized as are those of honeybees, and larvae at the periphery of the brood may receive less care than a ten-fold variation in worker mass results from the accidental neglect of some larvae. Given that larvae are reared in a controlled environment by specialized nest workers, it seems more likely that this size variation has an adaptive function and that the colonies benefit from rearing workers of a range of sizes. pollen n.花粉 larva n.幼虫 larvae n.幼虫的复数 brood n.一窝动物 ten-fold 十倍 rear v.养育 n.后部,背部 lt can be inferred that the author of the passage considers the variation in size of bumblebee workers to beA.serendipitous serendipity n.机缘巧合B.unpredictableC.inconsequentialD.advantageousE.unfortunate D. 定位到文章最后 benefit. In the context in which it appears,“determine” most nearly meansA. orderB. discoverC. controlD. decipherE. terminate C. 简单题. passage 205Zora Neale Hurston’s 1942 autobiography, Dust Tracks on a Road, has received some of the most negative criticism of any of Hurston’s books. Among critics’ complaints-some from Hurston’s warmest admirers-is the work’s fragmentary nature, a nature which, while presented in other Hurston texts, including the universally acclaimed novel Their Eves Were Watching God, is particularly conspicuous in Dust Tracks. The complaints about Dust Tracks are valid if one insists on the cardinal conventions of autobiography: traditional autobiographical structure and formal organization, and a focused projection of the autobiographical persona. But Dust Tracks portrays a persona that resists reduction to a coherent unity-a person of many moods who is in tension with the world in which she moves. In order to correspond better to this persona, Dust Tracks focuses on the fragmented life of Hurston’s imagination: the psychological dynamics of her family,community stories, and characters of friends. valid adj.有效的,合理的,有根据的 convention n.习俗；常规；惯例 cardinal adj.最主要的，基本的 persona n.表面形象 deficiency n.缺乏,不足 The primary purpose of the passage is A. explain why Dust Tracks has been less well received than other similarly structured works by Hurston.B. argue that a supposed deficiency in Dust Tracks actually contributes to the work’s presentation of its subject.C. compare the critical reaction to Dust Tracks with the critical reaction to Their Eyes Were Watching God.D. point out specific similarities between the structure of Dust Tracks and the structure of Hurston’s other works.E. suggest that some critics’ evaluations of Dust Tracks is influenced by their rejection of certain conventions of autobiography. 答案：B解析：文章一开头提到Dust Tracks on a Road, has received some of the most negative criticism，而后文对这个现象进行解释。然后作者转折了，说这种错误是有原因的，所以B选项的描述最合适，supposed deficiency就是那种“被信以为真的缺陷”，实际上是没有缺陷的。 The author of the passage suggests that critics’ complaints about the structure of Dust Tracks are A. not valid, because Dust Tracks should not be judged by the standards of conventional autobiography.B. unjustified, because they have not been directed at other Hurston texts that are similarly structured.C.justified, given the extent to which Dust Tracks is autobiographical.D.inexplicable, given the critical response to Their Eyes Were Watching God.E.compelling, because Huston’s warmest admirers have complained the most strenuously. 答案：A【微信公众号：张巍老师GRE】从But Dust Tracks portrays a persona that resists reduction to a coherent unity开始，文章就在描述这个小说为什么会fragmentary，然后说很多东西是因为作者必须要描绘一个不同的persona，所以就不符合传统的标准了，所以这个题答案选A选项，因为文章最后是在为这个Dust Tracks的作者做辩护了。 Which of the following best describes the organization of the passage? A. A situation is presented and an explanation of how that situation developed is offeredB. Two opposing points of view are contrasted and their relative merits are evaluated.C. An orthodox view is discussed, a challenge to it is analyzed, and the original view is affirmedD. A point of view is described and an analysis challenging that point of view follows.E. A dispute is analyzed and several points of agreement between the two sides are identified. 答案：D解析：文章的结构从前两个题就很容易看出来，就是先提出了传统的观点，然后再反驳了传统的观点，所以最合适的选项是D选项。 passage 206African American painter Malvin Gray Johnson (1896-1934) grew up in urban environments,including New York City, but in 1934 visited and painted scenes from the small town of Brightwood Virginia. Some critics have celebrate the Brightwood paintings, which depict a vibrant natural landscape and close-knit Black community, as Johnson’s discovery of an “authentic” African American life in the rural South. This view, which reflects a common tendency to regard African American artists’ imagery as unmediated documentation of direct experience, overlooks Johnson’s interpretive thinking. In truth, Johnson’s conceptualization of the South was largely formed before he left New York, where he had studied the French expressionist Paul Cezanne. Johnson's Brightwood paintings reflect Cézanne's stylistic influence and tendency to present rural life as an idyllic alternative to modern industrialism. The primary purpose of the passage is to A. contest a particular interpretation of Johnson’s Brightwood paintingsB.compare johnson’s Brightwood paintings to French Expressionist artC. use information about johnson’s historical context to illuminate the social significance of hisBrightwood paintingsD. explain why the work of African American painters is sometimes misunderstoodE. call attention to an aspect of johnson’s technique that has been largely overlooked contest v.争辩；就…提出异议 A解析：本文结构可概括为：some critics have celebrated…; This view overlooks…; In truth, …A选项正确。B选项错，以偏概全，这是一个细节。C选项错，social significance无中生有。D选项错，本文讨论的是Johnson的作品，而不是African American painters。E选项错，largely overlooked无中生有 For the following question, consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. The highlighted sentence has which of the following functions in the passage? A.lt expands upon a point made in the previous sentence.B. lt helps explain a common tendency described earlier in the passageC. lt identifies a way in which Johnson sought to differentiate his work from that of other artists. 不定项不一定非得选2个. 依据事实选择. A解析：A选项正确。高亮句tendency to present rural life是对前一句Johnson’s conceptualization of South was largely formed before he left New York的expand.B、C选项文中无依据。

title: GRE填空11
content: 6 选 2section 697.Rebecca West’s book Black Lamb and Grey Falcon is a singularity__achievement,1,100pages that meld the genres of travel narratives, autobiography, historical analysis,andphilosophical meditation.A.evanescentB. pettyc. polymathicD. incongruousE. encyclopedicF. fleeting genre n.体裁 解析：后文meld the genres of travel narratives, autobiography, historical analysis, and philosophical meditation说明这本书的全面，所以正确答案选CE选项。polymathic全面的，encyclopedic广博的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：RW的书Black Lamb and Grey Falcon是一个突出的全面的成就，有1100页而且融合了旅行叙事诗，自传，历史分析和哲学思考。 8.She expected her book to be___, but in fact few of her readers disagreed with its premise that street art, long considered a mere sideshow entertainment, deserved to be regarded as high art.A. controversialB. dramaticC. impressiveD. acclaimedE. provocativeF. popular 解析：后面说很少不同意她，but转折，说明本身她认为她的书会引起争议，所以正确答案选AE选项。controversial引起争议的，provocative引起争议的。 翻译：她期望她的书是会引起争议的，但是实际上她的读者很少不同意他的前提，即街头艺术（长期被认为仅仅是杂耍娱乐活动）值得被当成是高等艺术。 9.Researchers have recorded around 60 separate behaviors for worker honeybees a number that seems to___the achievements of many mammals: even the versatile bottle nose dolphin only performs about twice the number a worker honeybee manages.A. approximateB. eclipsec. reflectD. compoundE. outdoF. echo 解析：冒号后面拿哺乳动物最厉害的来进行比较，说明工蜂的行为已经超越了很多普通哺乳动物，正确答案选BE选项。eclipse超越，outdo超过。 翻译：研究者记录了工蜂60个独立行为，这个数量超过了很多哺乳动物的能力：就算是多才多艺的宽吻海豚也仅仅能够表现工蜂两倍的完成能力。 10.Despite its best efforts to stimulate sales, the book selling business remains far from___ it has high fixed costs in wages and rent,and falling prices make these ever harder to spur.A. effectiveB. healthyC. innovativeD. robustE. stingyF. parsimonious 解析：尽管很大的努力，但是销售还是远远不好，far from取反，所以空格选正面评价词，正确答案选BD选项。healthy强劲的，robust强劲的。 翻译：尽管尽了最大的努力来刺激销售，但是书籍销售仍然不强劲，因为它有很高的工资和租金的固定成本，而且降价让这些东西更难去推动了。 section 707.Every illness is a story, and when Annies began it was characterized by the kinds of ___details that mean nothing until seen in hindsight.A. salientB. unexceptionalC.conspicuousD. suggestiveE.abundantF.nondescript hindsight 事后聪明；事后的领悟 解析：注意关键词组in hindsight，意思是“事后之见”。所以之前是属于同义重复，对应nothing，正确答案选BF选项。unexceptional普通的，nondescript无特征的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：每个病症都有不同的表现，当Annies这种病开始时它被描述成一些平常的表现，这些表现当时没有任何值得在意的细节，直到事后才被发现。 8.Peoples decisions about childbearing depend on innumerable personal consideration and societal factors,yet even knowing this, demographers are often____: their projections of birthrates frequently turn out to be embarrassingly at odds with reality.A. sanguineB. flummoxedC. inconsistentD. overconfidentE. heartenedF. confounded childbearing n. 分娩 BE AT ˈODDS (WITH STH) 与...有差异，相矛盾 解析：通过冒号后面的解释说明内容倒推出空格选一个at odds with的广义同义词，那么正确答案选BF选项。flummoxed困惑的，confounded困惑的。 翻译：人们对于分娩的决定依赖于人们自己数不清的考虑和社会因素，尽管人口统计学家知道这个，它们还是很困惑：他们的调查出生率的项目经常被证明和现实是令人尴尬地矛盾。 9.The brain has become, for many people,____the biological machinations of the self, and the self-knowledge promised by neuroscience has ignited a hunger to understand how new findings weigh in on age-old questions.A. tantamount toB. synonymous withC. implicated inD. divorced fromE. detached fromF. subservient to 解析：同义重复，空格对应后文的promised by neuroscience，说明人们已经有这个习惯（毕竟科学都是这么说的）来把大脑就当成是一种biological machinations of the self，正确答案选AB选项。tantamount to等同于，synonymous with同义的。 翻译：大脑对于很多人来说已经变得等同于自我的生物规划了，而且这种由神经科学保证的自我认识已经激起一种饥渴来理解新的发现是如何加入到和老套的问题的辩论中去的。 完全没头绪… 10.Although scientific progress leads to constant revision of ideas, one observation that has remained____ over the years is that there are a lot of insects in the world: some 950,000 species have been identified.A. robustB. significantC. strongD. perplexingE. confoundingF. obscure 解析：前面尽管有revision of ideas，但是还是有没有改变的东西，所以空格选revision的反义，正确答案选AC选项。robust强壮的，strong强壮的。 翻译：尽管科学研究进程意味着不断修正想法，一种几年来仍然有效的观察数据显示，世界上有很多很多的昆虫，其中950000种类已经被认定。 section 717.We do not always use words in accordance with their dictionary definitions, for meaning often fluctuates with context: that does not mean, however, that we are completely____in how we use language.A. rote n.死记硬背B. unconstrainedC. irrationalD. unpredictableE. freeF. methodical fluctuate v.波动 解这个题很关键! 解析：虽然单词的意思会变，但是并不意味我们完全在用词上面是没有限制的，正确答案选BE选项。unconstrained不受限的，free自由的。 翻译：我们使用单词的时候不会经常根据字典的定义，因为单词的意思会因为上下文而改变：但这并不意味着我们在使用语言的时候是完全不受限制的。 8.Today the chair of task force in charge of revising the psychiatric diagnostic manual is ___ post-people work for years to position themselves as candidates—but in the early 1970s,descriptive psychiatry was a backwater.A.a covetedB.an arduous adj. 艰辛的，困难的C.a taxingD.a lucrative adj. 获利多的，赚大钱的E.an enviableF.an influential post n.职位,工作 backwater n.与世隔绝的地区,落后的地区 解析：后文说20世纪70年代早期，精神病诊断是落后状态，所以根据but推知前面应该说这个职位是很好的，所以正确答案选AE选项。coveted梦寐以求的，enviable羡慕的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：今天负责修订精神病诊断手册的特遣部队的主席是让人羡慕的职位—工作很多年才获得竞选人席位的人—但是在20世纪70年代早期，诊断精神病是处于落后状态。 9.The astronomer admits that his interpretation of so-called Population III stars is___ at present since no one has yet done any real calculations to see if it holds up under closer scrutiny.A. spuriousB. speculativeC. predictiveD. conjecturalE. fabricated v.编造；捏造F. implausible 解析：空格对应后文if it holds up under closer scrutiny，说明这个理解是不确定的，推测的，正确答案选BD选项。speculative推测性的，conjectural推测的。 翻译：天文学家承认他对于所谓的Population III stars的理解在目前是推测性的，因为没有人做过真正的计算来看是否它能够在进一步的检验之下保持下来。 10.Excessive focus on what might have been can cause in us feelings of restlessness and regret,but some scientists are beginning to think that fancying an alternative reality might have___ effects as well.A. subtleB. adverseC. restorativeD. pleasurableE. unfavorableF. tonic 解析：这个题最关键的点是要知道excessive focus on what might have been=fancying an alternative reality，前面对于这种事情给予了负评价restlessness and regret，后面but转折，所以后面空格需要填入正评价，所以正确答案选CF选项。restorative促进康复的，tonic滋补的。理解: 我觉得选CF可能因为两个词意思更相近, 从句子本身只能推出应该选择一个正面的词. 翻译：过度关注于曾经可能出现过什么会导致我们感到坐立不安并且后悔，但是其他一些科学家开始认为幻想一个其他的可能事实可能也会让我们精神振奋。

title: 等价词day0405
content: 等价词04,05各自的前50个单词. day 05 primitive 原始的,初级的 preachy 爱说教的 admonish v.批评,告诫 capture v.俘获 decrepitude n.衰老,老朽 successive 连续的 unerring 万无一失的 stifle v.阻止 truncate v.截短 deflect v.使转向 artless 纯真的,朴素的 disparage v.贬低 snub v.冷落,抵制 elusive 难理解的,难抓住的 aspersion n.诽谤 hitch n.故障 staid 古板的,严肃的 gregarious 爱交际的,群居的 somber 严肃的,昏暗的 camaraderie n.友情 lethargic 无精打采的 deflate 使减少 vigorous 精力充沛的 flout v.公然蔑视 conform to v.遵从,与...一致 parsimonious adj.吝啬的 dramatic adj.剧烈的,引人注目的 day 04 budding 萌芽期的 endemic 地方性的 dexterous 机敏的 malodorous 难闻的 maverick n.特立独行的人 unexampled 前所未有的,无前例的 occult 神秘的 obfuscate v.使困惑,使迷惑 sycophantic 谄媚的 fixated 过分迷恋的 fusty 霉臭的,守旧的 glean v.搜集,获取 conspicuous adj.显眼的 sporadic 零星的 numinous 超自然的 erstwhile adj.过去的 disdain v.鄙视 waver v.摇摆,犹豫 expel v.开除,驱逐 dovish 和平主义的 belabor v.过分强调; 抨击

title: GRE填空10
content: 6 选 2section 67Despite the general___of Roman archaeological studies toward the major cities and their monuments, archaeology has contributed much to a better understanding of rural developments inRoman territory.A. opennessB. indifferenceC. hostilityD. animusE. biasF. orientation 解析：让步关系，后面说更好地理解了乡村地区，所以空格是体现关注城市，所以正确答案选EF选项。bias偏爱，orientation倾向。 翻译：尽管罗马考古研究对于大城市和纪念碑的普遍的倾向，考古学对于一个更好的理解罗马领土的乡村地区发展贡献得很多。 8.Our mass media are much more fascinated by bad ideas or the failure of good ones than by successes: we drown in bad news—tales of how things went wrong–but we have only the most___ discussion on how they might go right.A. incisiveB. tantalizing tantalize （以可望而不可即之物）逗引，招惹，使干着急C. trenchant 尖锐的；有效的；鲜明的(褒义)D. cursoryE. illusory 虚假的,幻觉的F. perfunctory 解析：对比关系，我们沉迷于坏新闻，所以我们对如何变好的讨论是不充足的，答案选DF选项。cursory粗略的，perfunctory敷衍的。 翻译：我们的大量媒体更关注于一些坏新闻或者是好人的失败而不是成功：我们沉迷于坏新闻中—事情如何变坏—但是我们仅仅对于我们如何变好有一些粗略的讨论。 9.A few decades ago the idea of animal morality would have been met with___; however, recent research suggests that animals not only act altruistically but also have the capacity for empathy, forgiveness, trust, and reciprocity.A. derisionB.resentmentC.dismissal n.开除，解雇；不予考虑，摒弃；驳回，不予受理；打发走，遣散；出局D.convictionE.ridiculeF. certainty 解析：however后文说动物无私，原谅，信任，互惠，所以之前对于动物道德一定是负评价，正确答案选AE选项。derision嘲笑，ridicule嘲笑。 翻译：几十年前动物道德的理念可能会遇到嘲笑：然而，最近的研究表明动物不仅很无私而且有同情，原谅，信任和互惠的能力。 At first,most of the famous fairy tales seem so implausible and so irrelevant to contemporary life that their____ is hard to understand.A. universalityB. persistenceC. appealD. ephemeralityE. survivalF. transience – transient adj.短暂的 解析：如此难以置信如此和当代生活无关，所以这种东西还能传下来是很难理解的一件事，正确答案选BE选项。persistence持续存在，survival持续存在。 翻译：一开始，大部分的童话故事看起来都是这么的难以置信并且和真实生活毫无关系，以至于它们的持续流传实在是让人难以理解。 section 687.Because archaeology explores the most profound changes in human history by means of a grossly incomplete record; it has invited the sort of bold, imaginative interpretation in which speculation too easily becomes___evidence.A. replaced byB.constrained byC.untethered fromD.divorced fromE. substituted for substitute v.取代,代替F. constricted by 解析：grossly incomplete record和bold, imaginative interpretation说明推论和证据很容易被分开，正确答案选CD选项。untethered from不被束缚的，divorced from与…分离的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：因为考古学上用来探索最深刻的在人类历史上的变化是基于及其不完整的记录，这就需要大胆且富有想象力的解释来进行理解，这些猜测因为没有足够的证据容易变得与现实脱离。 During the eighteenth century, improvements in their material circumstances did not necessarily mean expanded independence for women elite families and, arguably, the social conventions of gentility____more of their time and energy. A. providedB. justifiedC.demandedD.grantedE.exacted exact v.索求,要求,强求F.rationalized v.使...合理化 解析：not necessarily mean expanded independence说明女性仍然不独立，所以后文空格要选一个动词体现女性无法独立，所以正确答案选CE选项。demand强烈要求，exact强求。 翻译：十八世纪，她们的物质环境改善并不一定意味着为妇女精英家庭有更多的独立，可以说，这个社会的礼仪传统要求她们付出更多的时间和精力。 9.For certain economists,”pure” economic theory, that is, economic theory____a specific social structure, is impossible, much like a concept of anatomy that investigates no specific species.A. attuned toB.abstracted fromC.derived fromD.divorced fromE.sensitive toF. analyzed in attune v.使协调,使合拍 解析：通过like a concept of anatomy that investigates no specific species的类比关系，看出空格应该选investigate no的同义词，所以正确答案选BD选项。abstracted from与…分离，divorced from与…分离。 翻译：对于一些特定的经济学家，“纯”经济理论，即与某种特定的社会构架剥离开来的经济理论，是不可能的，因为这就像在调查非特定物种的解剖学概念。 10.The professor’s habitual air of____ was misleading front, concealing amazing reserves of patience and a deep commitment to his students’learning.A. cordiality cordial adj.热情友好的B. irascibilityC. disorganizationD. conviviality convivial adj.欢乐的,快活的E. diffidenceF. exasperation 解析：concealing amazing reserves说明表面上的是reserve的反义，所以正确答案选BF选项。irascibility易怒，exasperation恼怒。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：这个教授脾气暴躁的说法是个被人误解的一面，这隐藏了他背后的有耐心和对学生的学习付出了巨大的贡献。 单空section 751.Since the deficit predicament is fundamentally a long-term problem, the legislature’s___ short-term approaches has actually compounded the difficulty in each succeeding year, eroding the state credit rating in the process.A. vexation regardingB. skepticism aboutC. addiction toD. wariness ofE. demonization of 解析：根据since…得知长期解决方案才是好的，再根据后文说短期解决方法搀和了很多困难得知，立法者是一直在使用短期方法解决赤字问题，对应的正确答案选C选项。addiction沉溺。 翻译：因为赤字困境从根本上来讲是一个长期问题，立法机关沉溺于提供的短期办法实际上已经加重了其后每年会发生的困难，在这个过程中破坏了国家信用评级。 2.His____speaking style notwithstanding, William Perkins has long been seen as the moderate face of his political party.A. genteelB. mundaneC. affableD. captivatingE. vehement 解析：notwithstanding尽管，所以空格和后面取反，后文moderate face表明了一个温和的特征，所以正确答案选E.vehement激烈的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：他的演讲风格尽管还是激烈，WP长期以来一直被他所属的政党看作是温和的人。 section 761.Like her literary heroine, George Eliot, Barbara Kingsolvers is an old-fashioned____, deeply curious about all branches of human learning.A. prodigyB. polymathC. tyroD. ante n.(扑克等牌类游戏中的) 底注E. philistine n.文化修养低的人 选B. 2.Physicists’opinions diverge on whether the unexpected phenomena that can occur in systems more complex than individual particles represent new physical principles, or whether the principles involved are __, in that they rely, albeit in an extremely complicated way, on known physical principles.A. extraneous 没有直接联系的；无关的B.inexpressibleC.derivativeD. heterogeneousE.uncorrelated 解析：or whether表明空格是和前面的new physical principles取反义，所以找一个能体现“旧”的意思的词，所以正确答案选C选项。derivative衍生的，非原创的。 翻译：物理学家们的意见分歧在于是否可以说明一个系统比单个粒子发生的意外现象要更复杂地表了一个新的物理原理，又或者是所涉及的原则就是陈旧的，因为他们依赖于已知的物理原则，尽管是一种极端复杂的方式。 section 77 这俩题都挺好的In an ironic twist, the recent____of the reductive observational methods that have enabled science to progress for four centuries may turn out to be science’s biggest step forward.A. introductionB. validationC. acceptanceD. standardizationE. questioning twist n.转折 twins 双胞胎 这个题很考验句子划分, may turn out to be … 的内容都是 ___ 处所填入名词的谓语和宾语. 当然, 认识twist这个词也很关键. 解析：通过ironic推出空格要和后面的science’s biggest step forward取反，后面是正评价，所以前面填入一个负评价词即可，正确答案选E选项。questioning质疑。 翻译：这是一个戏剧性的转折，最近对于那些能够使科学家连续四个世纪进步的还原观测方法的质疑最终被证明是科学家向前迈的最大一步。 2.Even though the municipal government was not totally___ the positive review of the charter,the mayor nevertheless decided to veto the laws.A. garrulous aboutB. enthusiastic aboutC. sanguine aboutD. approbatory toE. unsympathetic with municipal adj. 城市的，市政的 veto n.否决权 v.否决,禁止 解析：转折之后是否决，所以转折之前是不否决=不是不同情，所以正确答案选E选项，unsympathetic with对…不同情。 翻译：尽管市政府对于这个章程的正面的观点不是完全不同情，但是市场却还是决定要投票否决这些法律。

title: GRE填空09
content: 单空section 67 Reading chunks of Shapiro’s verse in one sitting,it must be said, exposes the___ nature of his writing: scads of poems are too glancing to strike a nerve, scarcely worth a second reading. A. jejuneB. esotericC.corrosive adj.腐蚀的D. finicky adj.过分讲究的,过分注意的E.indiscreet adj.轻率的,不慎重的 解析：解释说明，取后文的同义，很多诗篇都太粗略以至于引不起读者的共鸣，根本不值得花一秒钟去阅读说明找负评价，所以正确答案选A选项。A枯燥乏味的。 翻译：一口气读完Shapiro的大篇幅的诗，不得不说，暴露出了诗人写作里天生的枯燥无味：很多诗篇都太粗略以至于引不起读者的共鸣，根本不值得花一秒钟去阅读。 2.The painter’s problem, like that of an author whose early literary masterpiece exhausts the themes it embodies, is how to__his first highly acclaimed efforts with works of comparable significance and presence.A. combineB. illuminate v.照射;阐明,解释C.realizeD.amend v.修改,修订E. follow 解析：通过masterpiece得知之前这个画家成功过，那么现在的问题是延续这种成功。正确答案选E选项。follow再续。 翻译：就像一个早期的文学著作耗尽了其中包含的主题的作家一样，这个画家的问题是 怎样用和他第一个收到高度赞扬的作品具有类似重要性和presence的作品来延续他的成功. section 681.The presidents’ cordial greeting may seem to be a small gesture of friendliness, but it is not without____in the heretofore stifled atmosphere of the society’s meetings. A. significanceB. impertinence impertinent adj.粗鲁无礼的C. nostalgiaD. precedent n.先例E. triviality n.琐事,小事; cordial adj.热情友好的 stifle v.扼杀,使...窒息 解析：but前后转折，所以后面的特征是前面small的反义词，not without双重否定等于肯定，所以后面选small的反义词，正确答案选A选项。significance重大，重要。 翻译：总统的亲切问候也许可以看作一个友好的小举动，但它对于气氛窒息一般的社会会议并不是没有重大意义的。 2.The purpose of accounts of the Amazons for their male Greek recorders was____ , to teach both male and female Greeks that all-female groups, formed by withdrawal from traditional society,are destructive and dangerous.A. deceptive adj.欺骗性的B. didacticC. pre-cautious adj.预防的,警惕的D. vengeful adj.复仇的E. reflective adj.沉思的;反光的 答案: B 说教的.解析: 看了一圈, 就是不要管翻译, 空格的地方是修饰purpose的, 对应的就是to teach, 甭管这个句子是什么意思, 总之didactic 对应 to teach. section 691.The often-cited parallels between human communities and insect colonies are____: the cooperation found among social insects is essentially due to the insects genetic ties, while humans often collaborate with non-relatives.A. superficialB.obviousC. hackneyed adj.陈腐的,平庸的D.contradictoryE.uncanny adj.离奇的,难以解释的 答案: A 肤浅的.分析: 前面说这个观点把 人类 和 昆虫 parallel, 但是后面说人类和昆虫的合作的机制其实是不一样的, 所以, 前面的观点是 不对的. In the nineteenth century, geology became so respected among middle-class Britons that the science came to be seen as__, a yardstick by which other disciplines measured their scientific rigor and imaginative power. A. accessibleB. derivativeC. pragmatic adj.务实的D. empiricalE. paradigmatic yardstick n.码尺;衡量标准 rigor n.严格 解析：后文的a yardstick by which other disciplines measured their scientific rigor and imaginative power可以看出空格填入一个“标准尺码”的同义词，正确答案选E选项。paradigmatic典范的。 翻译：在十九世纪，地质学在英国中层阶级中变得十分值得敬重，科学变成了作为示范的衡量标准，用来衡量其他学科的科学严谨性和想象力。 section 701.One might expect someone of such____ views to have a comparably dour personality, but people who have worked with her talk about how she uses her considerable charm to convince people that she is right. A. forbearingB. convolutedC. felicitous adj.贴切的；恰当的；D. astringent adj.(能使皮肤或伤口)收敛的，止血的;尖刻的；辛辣的;微苦而清新的E. hyperbolic adj.双曲线的,夸张的 解析：此题同义重复dour，选dour的广义同义词，dour有“严厉的”意思，所以正确答案选D选项。astringent尖刻的，严格的。 翻译：一个人可能会认为像她这样给出如此尖酸观点的人有一种严格的性格，但是和她一起工作的人们却描述她是如何利用自己的亲和力去说服别人她是对的。 2.Some species camouflage patterns may be__, granting those species a higher chance of survival in a heterogeneous environment. A. plasticB. subtleC. singular adj.单数的,突出的D. consistentE. imitable adj.可模仿的- camouflage n.v.伪装，隐蔽；（士兵作伪装用的）迷彩服，伪装色 解析：因果关系，动物有更高的存活几率是因为伪装方法多变，正确答案选A选项。plastic可变的，可塑的。 翻译：一些物种的伪装术十分多变，使得这些物种能在各种环境下有很高的存活机会。 section 711.The monitoring is not__: on the contrary, the defendant and his or her attorney are required to be given notice of the governments listening activities. A. obtrusive adj.扎眼的；过分炫耀的；显眼的B. circumspectC. surreptitious adj.秘密的,鬼鬼祟祟的D. adroitE. meticulous defendant n. 被告，被告人 attorney n. 律师；代理人 解析：on the contrary后面的内容与前面的空格取反，后文说政府会通知，说明这个监视不是秘密进行的，所以正确答案选C选项。surreptitious鬼鬼祟祟的。 翻译：这个监听并不是秘密进行的，相反，辩护方和律师会被通知政府的监听行动。 2.When studying human history, one must be aware that the_____between historical periods are arbitrary; certainly none of the people alive at the time were aware of a shift from one era to another.A. judgementsB. ideologiesC. innovationsD. demarcations n. 划分；划界；限界E. episodes n.一段经历,插曲 解析：通过certainly none of the people alive at the time were aware of a shift from one era to another能推出空格需要填入一个体现无法感受不同时代转移的特征，那么正确答案选D选项。demarcation界限。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：当人们学习人类史时，他们应该明白每个历史时期之间的界限是十分随意的，可以肯定的是在那时生活的人们不会感受到时期和时期之间的变化。 对我来说, 这个题的关键是 shift, 读出朝代之间的转移. 然后还得认识demarcation section 721.Although his friends insisted that his black garb was simply depressing, Peter felt just the opposite-that it gave him an air of upbeat,____maturity. A. melancholic adj. 忧郁的；抑郁的；B. wearisome 乏味的；令人疲劳的；使人厌倦的C. salaciousD. aghast adj. 吓呆的，惊骇的；惊恐的E. urbane upbeat adj. 乐观的，积极向上的 urbane adj. 彬彬有礼的，温文尔雅的(在社交场合说话穿着得体的)；都市化的 词根: urban 解析：空格和upbeat并列关系，所以找正评价词修饰maturity即可，所以正确答案选E选项。urbane温文尔雅的。 翻译：尽管他的朋友们坚持认为她的黑色衣服让人感觉很沮丧，皮特仍然有相反的想法，这给了他一种乐观的气氛和温文儒雅的成熟感。 2.The actor’s performance was so absurdly___ that Gwen felt a little ashamed to have to resort to tissues in the final scene. A. proficientB. unfeasible adj.可行的；行得通的C. seditious 煽动性的D. maudlin adj.伤感的E. accommodating tissue n.(人、动植物细胞的)组织;面巾纸 restore n. 旅游胜地，度假胜地; n.v. 诉诸，求助于 解析：Gwen非常羞愧去用了纸巾，说明这个空格必然和哭相关，而且absurdly刚好解释了后文的ashamed，正确答案D选项。maudlin伤感的。 翻译：这个演员的表演是如此荒唐的伤感，以至于格温觉得自己在最后一场用纸巾擦泪水有点可耻。 section 731.During the Renaissance, history was thought to be____: it supplied instances of good and bad behavior in the past, thus informing the ethical precepts of the present. A. amoralB. subjectiveC. superfluous adj. 多余的，过剩的D. exemplaryE. progressive precept n.（思想、行为的）准则，规范 supply v.提供 正确答案: D. 知道几个单词意思之后, 可以确定答案. 2.History teaches us that science is not___enterprise; indeed, it is quite the opposite, a motley assortment of tools designed to safeguard researchers against their own biases. A. an opportunisticB. an anomalousC. a haphazardD. a collective adj.集体的,共有的,全体成员的E. a monolithic adj.大一统的,整体的,巨大而平庸的 motley adj.混杂的；杂七杂八的 assortment n.各种各样 section 74 Many legislators who helped Roosevelt shape the New Deal___ the fact that emerging social problems affected every segment of the population; nonetheless, they often acted with a view to aiding only their own constituents. A.disregardedB. bemoaned v.哀怨,悲叹C.ignoredD.disputedE. downplayed nonetheless = nevertheless = 然而 dispute v.争论,辩论 constituent n.选民;成分,构成要素 解析：后面转折说他们却只帮助自己的选民，再通过让步关系得出前面空格是他们明白社会问题是能影响整体选民的，所以整体表达的意思是“虽然他们抱怨某个事会影响所有人，但是在处理这个事的时候却只关注自己的选民”，所以正确答案选B选项。bemoan抱怨，哀叹。 翻译：很多帮助过罗斯福设立罗斯福新政的议员们都对于新出现的社会问题会影响每一个人口群体这个事实进行抱怨，但他们往往只是对自己的选民采取行动。 2.One thing both authors have in common is a striking amount of__: they claim to know how massive institutions, some of them richly endowed, all of them central to American society and culture, should be reshaped. A. hubrisB. propriety n.得体的举止；有分寸的行为C. biasD. prescience n.先见E. indolence n.懒散,懒惰 解析：冒号后面的内容说他们说话有种夸大的感觉，能对应这种特征的只能是A选项。hubris傲慢自大。 翻译：极其自命清高是每个作家都具有的共同特点，他们声称知道那些，全部都处于美国文化社会中心的，一部分拥有得天独厚的条件的庞大机构，都应该如何重塑。 6选2section 64As a critic, Nelson is noteworthy for her___: rather than presenting fully formed pronouncements, she is willing to let us watch as she works out her ideas.A. generosity n. 慷慨，大方B. humilityC. integrity n. 正直，诚实；完整，完全D. modestyE. eloquenceF. rhetoric 正确答案: BD. 谦虚, 冒号后面的意思我也懂了, 谦虚我觉得有点勉强, 不纠结了. 只能说可能 雄辩 和 修辞 不能完全算同义词. 8.Although in the mid-1970s nuclear power seemed poised for a still greater role in energy supply,in fact the____of its prestige had already begun.A. evaluationB. waningC. defenseD. underminingE. ebbing v.衰弱；衰退；减退F. vindication vindicate v.证实;证明...无罪 prestige n. 声望，威信 明确ebb的意思之后, 很明显是 BE. 9.The women’s rights movement has been mostly ___ in the Middle East, but it is likely that activists will be newly galvanized by the political upheavals currently sweeping the region.A. subverted v.颠覆；暗中破坏; 策反B. quiescentC. interminable adj.冗长的；没完没了的D. bootless adj.无用的; 徒劳的; 无效果的E. abeyant adj.adj. 暂时中止的,暂时搁置的F. feckless adj.软弱的 选BE; 纯纯考察单词. 10.Beatified by the Catholic Church in 1765, Italian cleric Ludovico Sabbatini is____each year on the day of his death,June 11.A.pledged v.保证,发誓,承诺;抵押B.evokedC.deified deify v.把...奉若神明D.venerated v.敬重,崇敬E.honoredF.christened christen v.为（某人）命名；给（某人）施洗 选DE; 选对了beatify to give a dead person a special honour by stating officially that he/she is very holy. section 657.What they see in Jimenez is the one candidate capable of decisive leadership, in stark contrast to Diaz, whose team in office has been marred by___.A. defensivenessB. corruptionC. irresolution n.优柔寡断；犹豫不决D. vacillationE. belligerence belligerent adj.好斗的；寻衅的；挑衅的F. pugnacity mar v.损毁,损伤 选CD. 对比, 前面的 果断, 后面的 就得是 犹豫不决 8.The research informing Gregory’s book on vegetarianism in Victorian England appears to be___, with a great deal of revealing detail on display and more than a third of the text taken up with footnotes.A.unevenB.excessive 过度的,过多的C.exhaustiveD. mixedE.inconsistentF. comprehensive 好选CF, 表示全面的. 9.He was a man of few words,__around all but his closest friends.A. laconic 简洁的,凝练的B. garrulous 喋喋不休的,话多的C. ascetic 过清苦生活的；（尤指）苦行的；禁欲的D. taciturnE. tempestuous 狂风暴雨的,激烈的,狂暴的 tempest n.暴风雨F. ambiguous 选AD. 10.There are many insights in the essay collected in Observations on modernity, but they are embedded in a dense English translation of a dense German original that may makemany of them___ to most readers.A. vapid adj. 无趣味的；无生气的；索然乏味的B. inaccessibleC. sagacious adj.有洞察力的,睿智的,精明的D. banalE. distressing distress n.忧虑；悲伤；痛苦F. opaque 选BF, 做对了. section 66lt is not unusual for American eduction leaders to hold up another nation as a model for school reform: in the mid-nineteenth century, such figures____ the professionalism and structure of thePrussian school system.A. enviedB.imitatedC. hailedD.augmentedE.acclaimedF.enhanced 解析：冒号后面重复前文的内容，空格对应hold up，hold up在这里是拿来做例子的意思，所以正确答案选CE选项。hail称赞，acclaim称赞。 翻译：对于美国教育先驱来说，能够将其他国家的教育模式作为雏形进行重改是不是不常见的，在十九世纪中，这些人物称赞了普鲁士学校系统的专业性和结构性。 In her career as an editor,she pruned and shaped many a writer’s___prose into crisp lucidity.A. waywardB. transparentC. errant adj.犯错误的,出格的;不定的D. urbaneE. elegantF. incisive prune v.修剪树枝 lucid adj.清晰的,易懂的 crisp adj.酥脆的 解析：找crisp lucidity的反义词，正确答案选AC选项。wayward难以控制的，errant不定的。 翻译：在她作为编辑的职业生涯中，她删掉而且改变了很多作家的无规律的诗，把它们变得非常简明扼要的清晰。 9.Philby secretly loathed the host of the party that he was attending, but it seemed____ to say so publicly.A. reconditeB. tactlessC. cleverD. malign v.（公开地）诽谤 adj. 有害的；邪恶的；（疾病）恶性的E. deftF. impolitic adj. 失策的；不明智的 解析：虽然不愿意，但是公开说出来还是不明智的，正确答案选BF选项。tactless不妥当的，impolitic不明智的。 翻译：P私下里厌恶这个他正在参加的聚会的主持人，但是如果公开说出来是不妥当的。 In American Indian art, the supposed distinction between modern and traditional was fabricated by critics, and when artists have control over interpretation of their own work, the distinction appear, happily, to have been____.A. eliminatedB. reinforcedC.put to restD.intensifiedE.recognizedF.established fabricate v.编造；捏造 解析：前面说这种distinction是被捏造出来的，所以后来如果艺术家能够自己控制翻译的话他们就会消除这种distinction，所以正确答案选AC选项。eliminate消除，put to rest使停止。 翻译：在美国印第安艺术中，这种想象中在现代和传统之间的区别是被评论家捏造出来的，而且当艺术家能够控制他们自己的作品的翻译之后，这种区别就很愉快地被消除了。

title: 雪后平淡的一天
content: 戒总是戒不掉我现在感觉很多事情没有做到最好就是没有走完最后10步, 已经走了90步就沾沾自喜, 只有捧起最后的奥布莱恩杯才算获得了总冠军啊, 常规赛72胜又有什么用呢.如何去掉身体里的奖励机制?今天中午day0, 明天肯定OK, 后天能坚持住吗? 就后天. 阅读莫名其妙的顺短阅读, 只是一个部分, 感觉第一句话看懂了, 基本上问题不大, 那几种题型主要是逻辑, 并不特别考察单词. 账本早饭5元的茶, 苦, 中午饭13热乎, 饱, 但是少点儿素菜, 晚饭18.8 一共36.8. 理了个发28, 但是充了112, 还能理3次. 背单词遇到小瓶颈了等价词170 * 5 = 850, 熟悉的123有几个词每次都是记不住, 打算单独拿出来好好看看.45就是基本不会的状态, 一天过两遍呢试试.直播背单词效果不好, 不涨粉丝, 先暂停. 明天5 个 短阅读10个 单空10个 6选2不少5个list挑战一下, 明天有24个小时呢, 也不算难, 这要是高中留的作业, 一晚上也是他.

title: GRE阅读02
content: passage 274The novel Georges, published under Alexander Dumas’name, may actually have been written by Felicien Mallefille. A comparison of Georges with well-known Dumas novels such as The Count of Monte Cristo suggests that Dumas had little to do with Georges. For example, Georges’ characters are tiresomely earnest, while those from Dumas’ wel-known novels crack jokes and utter colorful oaths. Meanwhile, in a technical sense, Georges is well-written, while The Count of Monte Cristo, with all its verve and sparkle, is full of redundancies, repetitions, and non sequiturs. As Umberto Eco discovered while attempting to translate The Count of Monte Cristo, the charm of Dumas’ novel and its “narrative wisdom”are inseparable from its “linguistically sludgy and gasping” prose. 解析：小说乔治（Georges），以D的名字出版，实际上可能是M写的。乔治这本小说与著名的D小说的比较表明，D与乔治没有任何关系。举例来说，乔治的人物真诚而又令人生厌，而D著名小说中那些人物则爱开玩笑。同时，从技术上讲，乔治写的很完美，而Count of Monte Cristo在充满活力和光芒的同时，到处都是重复和不拘一格。正如翁贝托·艾考（Umberto Eco）在尝试翻译Count of Monte Cristo时所发现的那样，D小说的魅力和其“叙事智慧”与它的“语言上的污秽和大喘气”密不可分。 tiresome adj.讨厌的,烦人的 earnest adj.认真的,真诚的 crack a joke 开玩笑,说笑话 utter adj.完全的,彻底的 v.出生,说,讲 oath n.宣誓,誓言 verve n.精力,激情,热情 sparkle v.闪烁 n.活力 non sequitur n.不合逻辑的推论 inseparable adj.不可分开的 sludgy adj.泥泞的 1.The author of the passage would be most likely to agree with which of the following statements about Dumas as a novelist? A. His use of non sequiturs detracts from the stylistic verve of his writing. detract v.贬低,减损 而 verve 和 non sequitur 都是形容 Dumas 这个人的作品的 stylistic adj.体裁上的,格式上的 B. His use of repetition has been overrated as effective novelistic technique. overrate v.高估,对...评价过高 无中生有 C.His reliance on humor results in one-dimensional characters. 也是属于纯扯淡类选项 D.His novels, while technically well written, have predictable plots. George 不是 D 的novel, George 是 well written , D 应该就不能说 well written. 而且后面还说了 D 的作品有很多重复. 再而且, predictable plots 可预测的情节也是扯淡. E.His writing displays narrative skill despite certain technical flaws. 文中最后一句. 这个选项的描述确实没毛病. 答案：E解析：根据Dumas as a novelist定位，文中在两个地方提到了D的小说特征。those from Dumas’ well-known novels crack jokes and utter colorful oaths. Meanwhile, in a technical sense, …with all its verve and sparkle, is full of redundancies, repetitions, and non sequiturs. E选项中说的narrative skill 对应“verve and sparkle”，certain technical flaws 对应 “ full of redundancies, repetitions, and non sequiturs”。A错：distract跟原文的意思正好相反。B错：overrated文中没有提到。C错：无中生有。D错：predictable plots无中生有。 2.According to the passage, which of the following is true regarding the novel Georges?A. lts authorship was widely questioned soon after its publication. widely 没体现, 只是作者一个人这样认为, 并没有提到当时社会上大众是怎么看的. B. Its characters are less interesting than those in most Dumas’ novels. 对的. 因为提到Duma的一个作品里有joke, 也说George 是 tiresome C. lt is marred by redundancies, repetitions,and non sequiturs. mar v.破坏,损害 后面这三个形容词都是形容D的作品的. D. lt presents unusual problems for translators. 翻译家翻译的是D的作品, 不是George E. It has often been compared favorably to The Count of Monte Cristo 去掉favorably, 因为adv.一般不会影响主要意思,只是作者比较了两部作品, 并不能说社会大众经常把两部作品相互比较. 答案：B解析：根据关键词定位回原文，B选项“Its characters are less interesting than those in most Dumas novels.”是文中“Georges’ characters are tiresomely earnest, while those from Dumas’ well-known novels crack jokes and utter colorful oaths. ”的同义改写。A错：无中生有。C错：redundancies, repetitions, and non sequiturs是D小说的特征。D错：无中生有。E错：无中生有。 3.The quotation from Umberto Eco most directly serves toA. underscore an apparent inconsistencyB. introduce a new explanationC. reevaluate the critical status of a workD. point out a contradiction in a critical stanceE. enumerate certain challenges of translation enumerate v.列举,枚举 这个题基本上五个选项翻译出来了就是排除法了.答案：A解析：定位到文章最后一句话，注意这里的as是正如的意思，明显是顺承证明上文的观点，所以答案选A选项。 passage 276While studying different-sized ant colonies, Cole discovered that when there were only a few ants in the space provided, each individual exhibited a chaotic pattern of activity and rest. As the density of the colony increased by the addition of more ants, Cole observed a sudden transition to dynamic order: patterns of activity and rest over the colony as a whole suddenly changed from chaotic to rhythmic. Why should the density of ants play an apparently crucial role in the transition from chaotic to ordered behavior?Ants interact with one another,and an active ant encountering an inactive one will stimulate the latter into movement. At low densities there are few encounters, but at higher densities activity can spread like a contagion through the colony. Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply.1.According to the passage, which of the following statements about ant interactions is true?A.The interaction between active and inactive ants leads to a change in the inactive ant’s behavior.B. When the density of an ant colony is low, there are relatively few interactions between ants.C. When there are many ants in an ant colony, the perceived lack of space often leads ants to inactivity. 2.In the context in which it appears,”ordered”most nearly meansA.preparedB. prearrangedC.regularD. peacefulE.restricted 简单题, 不过多的看了.在研究不同大小的蚁群时，C发现当提供的空间中只有几只蚂蚁时，每个蚂蚁都表现出混乱的活动和休息模式。随着添加更多蚂蚁而增加了colony的密度，C观察到了一个突然的转变，转向了秩序：整个colony的活动和休息模式突然从混乱变为有节奏。为什么蚂蚁的密度在从混沌行为向有序行为的转变中起着至关重要的作用？蚂蚁彼此互动，而一只活动的蚂蚁遇到不活动的蚂蚁会刺激后者运动。在低密度时，蚂蚁之间很少遇到，但在高密度时，活动可以像传染病一样在colony传播。 1.答案：AB解析：多选题。根据ant interactions定位，Ants interact with one another, and an active ant encountering an inactive one will stimulate the latter into movement. At low densities there are few encounters, but at higher densities activity can spread like a contagion through the colony. 前面一句对应A，后面一句对应B。C错，无中生有。2.答案：C解析：词汇题。根据上下文的意思，这里的ordered与chaotic取反，C选项regular最符合。 passage 245Native American music is unique in the world in having almost no string instruments. The fretless,single-string violin of Mexico’s Seri lndians is therefore often remarked on in studies of NativeAmerican music.Most scholars assume that the Seri violin descended from the European violin.The Spanish introduced a variety of string instruments to Mexico following the conquest (1519),and these subsequently spread widely in many forms. However, Helen Roberts questions other scholars’arguments that Mexican string instruments could not have preconquest origins simply because they are not mentioned by early Spanish sources and do not appear in indigenous Mexican illustrations.Roberts argues that because of their low volume, string instruments would not have been used in loud group contexts such as those depicted in Mexican manuscripts. 美洲原住民的音乐在世界上是独一无二的，几乎没有弦乐器。因此，墨西哥塞里印第安人的无音单弦小提琴在研究美洲原住民音乐时经常被提及。大多数学者认为塞里小提琴起源于欧洲小提琴。西班牙人在征服墨西哥之后(1519年)向墨西哥引进了各种弦乐器，这些乐器随后以多种形式广泛传播。然而，海伦·罗伯茨质疑其他学者的观点，即墨西哥弦乐器不可能起源于被征服前，仅仅是因为早期西班牙文献中没有提到它们，也没有出现在墨西哥土著的插图中。罗伯茨认为，由于弦乐器的音量小，它们不可能被用在吵闹的群体环境中，比如墨西哥手稿中描述的那些。 conquest n.征服,占领 illustration n.插图 be descended from … 是...的后裔 1.In the context in which it appears, “simply” most nearly meansA. artlesslyB. franklyC.ordinarilyD. slightlyE. just 2.It can be inferred from the passage that the view held by most scholars regarding the origins of the Seri violin is based in part onA. differences between the Seri violin and European violinsB. the rarity of string instruments among Native American peoples rarity n.罕见 C. the fact that the Seri violin lacks frets and has only a single string fret n.琴格 D.a resemblance between the Seri violin and Spanish string instruments of the sixteenth centuryE.the means by which string instruments spread in Mexico following the conquest 答案 E解析：定位在the spanish introduced…这句话，这个结构应该就是most scholars assume…提出观点，下一句对观点进行原因解释。开头两句是事实，是文章的背景。答案选 E。 3.The passage suggests that in Roberts’view, the Seri violinA. may be represented in Mexican manuscripts that have yet to be foundB. was probably modeled on string instruments introduced to Mexico by the SpanishC. was not likely to have been in use prior to the Spanish conquest of MexicoD. was best suited for playing in relatively quiet settingsE.was probably capable of greater volume than most scholars have assumed 我这个题目错的原因是没有仔细看完所有选项就选择了.正确答案是: D, 对应最后一句话. 4.Which of the following best describes the purpose of the highlighted sentence in the passage asa whole?A. It introduces an alternative to a widely held view.B. lt casts doubt on a point made in the first sentence of the passage. cast doubt 怀疑 其实cast不认识也不影响 C. lt explains why scholars disagree about a particular issue.D. lt cites evidence overlooked by scholars previously mentioned in the passage.E. It suggests a reason for the assumption mentioned in the preceding sentence. 句子作用题目. 读懂文章逻辑, 读懂每个选项就OK了.选择 : E. passage 219Ecologists had assumed that trees in the consistently warm tropics grew at a slow but steady rate,unvarying from year to year. However, a study at La Selva, Costa Rica, showed that trees grew less in hotter years and more in cooler ones: between 1984 and 2000, dramatic differences occurred in the six species of trees studies, with trees adding twice as much wood in some cooler years as they did in the scorching El Nino year of 1997-1998.Because tree growth is an index of the balance between photosynthesis, in which trees absorb carbon dioxide (C02) from the atmosphere and release oxygen, and respiration, in which the opposite occurs, the La Selva data were the first hint that rapidly rising global temperatures, driven by human-generated emissions of co2, may be pushing tropical forests to release more CO2, thereby intensifying global warming.This raised serious questions about a popular theory that tropical forests act as a sponge, soaking up much of the excess CO2 that humans pump into the atmosphere.The La Selva data are consistent with a model of global CO2 flux developed by Keeling, who concluded that the amount of CO2 taken up in tropical landmasses rose in cooler years and fell in hotter ones,accounting for year-to-year changes in the amount of CO2 that stays in the atmosphere. tropic n.热带地区 scorch v.烧焦,烤糊 scorching adj.酷热的 photosynthesis n.光合作用 respiration n.呼吸 soak up 吸收 其实放在语境里能猜出来 flux n.不断的变化 account for 解释,说明 1.The primary purpose of the passage is toA. present additional evidence to support a popular theoryB.show the underlying similarities of two seemingly contradictory theoriesC. point out the implications of a particular study for two related theoriesD.provide an alternative explanation for a well-documented phenomenonE.reconcile two competing theories that explain a phenomenon 2.The passage supports which of the following statements about the trees in the La Selva study?A.During the El Nino year, they added considerably less wood than they did in cooler years duringthe period of 1984-2000.B. During the El Nino year, they typically had higher rates of photosynthesis than they did in otheryears during the period of 1984-200o.C. During the El Nino year, they released considerably more oxygen than they did in cooler yearsduring the period of 1984-2000.D.During the El Nino year, they took up considerably more CO2 than they did in cooler yearsduring the period of 1984-2000.E.The amount of CO2 that they absorbed remained constant throughout the entire period of 1984-2000. 3.The passage suggests that as temperatures rise, trees in the tropical regionsA. continue to grow at a slow but steady rateB.grow less and intensify photosynthesisC.emit more Co2 and oxygenD.increase overall respiration and decrease overall photosynthesisE.grow more and absorb more CO2

title: 大雪,还不错的状态
content: 还不错的状态首先这个状态只能是相对自己还不错.早起, 一个list, 上午填空练了, 金铲铲第二, 复习一个list, 篮球, 吃午饭.中午看美女, 金铲铲输了, 午休, 下午起床打球, 潜水员戴夫, 吃晚饭, 购买泸溪河, 晚饭后的上网冲浪.开始阅读, 读了一个之后看留学信息看了1h, 又做了两个阅读.感受: 时间其实是很宝贵的,不要那么容易满足, 下午好歹干一个事情会好很多, 晚上多复习一个, 或者中午写一个日记 胡思乱想韩国人好好看, 好白晚饭后遛弯拍照, 雪景教育? 最终目的是学会知识, 小学初中高中在高考模式下, 可以完全没有老师考到680分(这个有点偏激的论断适合发自媒体), 但是不能没有同学这一段美好的童年经历. 残酷现实GPA没那么高, 学校牌子不算最硬的, 海外学校很难申请, 机构没啥用咱冤枉钱已经花了.至少知道了, 牛津剑桥帝国理工就先别想了.我感觉对我来说, 没什么目标的人, 其实申请学校最重要的是吹牛逼, 那我要的就是牌子, 牌子就是NUS和南洋理工大学, 香港那几个在我自己看来还是没那么牛逼, 其他的可能牌子大, 但是我够不到. 另外一个就是价格, 看看价格, 如果欧洲有比较好的奖, 可以考虑, 要不然就算了. 今日开销早饭7 + 午饭13 + 晚饭13 + 泸溪河28(泸溪河要当早饭了, 明天早上去买一个喝的, 带点牛肉, 带点巧克力, OK了!)

title: GRE阅读01
content: passage 297In A Fine Brush on Ivory, his appreciation of novelist Jane Austen, Richard Jenkyns remarks that in Austen scholarship, there are pressure that cause ordinary critical circumspection to break down. Principal among those pressures is the peculiar affection in which the person of Jane Austen is held by many readers. This affection is not altogether explained by admiration for he genius, nor is it entirely a symptom of nostalgia for her orderly, decorous, even mysterious life. Writer has led critics to approach her work in mostly biographical or historical ways, often in defiance of other critical fashions, especially the various formal approaches that have dominated modern literary criticism. 在《象牙上的画笔》一书中，J对小说家简·奥斯汀的评价是这样的：在奥斯汀的学术领域，存在着使普通的文学评论崩溃的压力。在这些压力中，最主要的是很多读者对简·奥斯汀持有的独特情感。这种感情不完全是因为对天才的钦佩，也不完全是对她井然有序、高雅、甚至神秘生活的怀念。作家引导评论家们以传记或历史的方式来看待她的作品，这些常常是对其他文学评论方式的蔑视，尤其是对现代文学批评中占主导地位的各种形式方法的蔑视。 如何知道一串单词是一本书的名字? 答: 看看例子.例如《The Little Prince》（小王子）、《To Kill a Mockingbird》（杀死一只知更鸟）、《1984》（1984）、《Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone》（哈利波特与魔法石）、《The Lord of the Rings》（指环王）、《The Great Gatsby》（了不起的盖茨比）、《Pride and Prejudice》（傲慢与偏见） ivory n.象牙 appreciate v.欣赏 principal adj.最重要的,主要的 n.大学校长 affection n.喜爱,感情 altogether adv.完全地 symptom n.症状 defiance n.违抗,蔑视 Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply.1.According to the passage, critics approach Jane Austen’s work in biographical or historical ways for which of the following reasons?A.They find her work particularly well suited to biographical and historical readings.B.They are unsatisfied with the formal approaches that have dominated modern literary criticism.C.They feel the need to know the baffling writer personally. baffle v.使困惑; adj.令人困惑的 其实这个单词去掉不影响句子意思. 2.In the context in which it appears, “appreciation of”most nearly meansA. gratitude toward 感激之情, 感谢B. awareness ofC.appraisal of appraisal 评估,评价D.esteem for esteem 尊重,敬重;把...看作,认为E. grasp of 解析：词汇题。在文章语境中，appreciation是“评价”之意，与C符合。 passage 294Some studies have shown that red-backed salamanders (RBS) are scarce in areas with acidic soils and that those present in such conditions have smaller-than-average bodies.Explanations have included the possibility that young RBS are adversely affected by acidic soil,that adult RBS can sense and may avoid acidic soil conditions,or that loss of RBS prey populations due to acidic soil could result in reduced RBS populations. Yet researchers found fairly high densities of large- bodied RBS at Lake Claire Watershed, where soil conditions are acidic.One hypothesis is that intraspecific geographical variation in acidity tolerance (ie. local adaptation to an acidic environment) could exist for RBS.Previous studies showof some salamander species to acidity. 1.Which of the following can be inferred about the studies mentioned in the highlighted portion n.一部分 of the passage? A.They may have undercounted RBS in their study areas due to faulty methodology. 他们可能因为错误的研究方法而把RBS的数量统计少了. B.They focused less on adult RBS than on RBS in the early stages of their development. C.They found evidence that acidic conditions adversely affect the prey on which RBS depend. prey n.猎物,v.捕食 D.They drew unsubstantiated conclusions about the possible adverse effects of acidic conditions on RBS. 第一句只是说了一种现象, 不能由一个现象infer出一种结论. E.They were conducted in areas where the soil conditions were similar to those at Lake ClaireWatershed. 答案：E解析：推断题。第一句讨论的是酸性土壤的rbs的生长情况，E正确，对应“Lake Claire Watershed, where soil conditions are acidic…”。A错，faulty methodology无中生有。B错，无中生有。C错，found evidence that acidic conditions adversely affect the prey 无中生有。D错，unsubstantiated conclusions逻辑错误。作者并未下定论。 2.The primary purpose of the passage is toA. cite evidence that appears to contradict a widely held assumption cite v.引用 B.present contrasting interpretations of a particular research findingC.explain how a particular environmental change can produce diverse outcomesD.note an unexpected finding and summarize new possible explanation for itE. identify a correlation and explain why one hypothesis about it is more persuasive than others 答案：D解析：主旨题。文章的结构是，一开始提出一种发现，然后提供解释。转折后提出新的发现，随后提供对于新发现的解释。D最符合。A错，文章不只是cite evidence。B错，文章提出两种findings。而不是针对一种finding的两种解释。C错，无中生有。E错，more persuasive 无中生有。 passage 282For Temnothorax ants in search of suitable rock crevices for new nest sites, size is an important consideration, and certain behaviors suggest how scouts might compare the size of several sites.After entering a crevice, scouts invariably exit and reenter.During their first inspection, they mark their route with their personal pheromones.(Experiments have shown that workers can distinguish their own pheromones from those of nest mates.) Some researchers believe that these ants are counting the frequency of intersections between their two exploratory trails. The smaller the area,the more likely they are to cross a spot twice.The observation that Temnothorax scouts always pave out a path of the same length on their first visit to sites strongly supports this hypothesis. 对于寻找合适的岩石裂缝作为新巢穴的Temnothorax蚂蚁来说，大小是一个重要的考虑因素，某些行为表明侦察兵可能会比较几个地点的大小。在进入裂缝后，侦察兵总是退出并重新进入。在第一次检查时，它们用自己的信息素标记路线。(实验表明，工蜂可以将自己的信息素与巢穴同伴的信息素区分开来。)一些研究人员认为，这些蚂蚁正在计算它们两条探索路径之间相交的频率。区域越小，它们越有可能两次穿过一个点。Temnothorax侦察兵总是在他们第一次访问地点时开辟出相同长度的路径，这一观察结果有力地支持了这一假设。 1.In light of the claim made by the “researchers”, it can be inferred that ants’ ability to distinguish their own pheromones from these of nest mates is important primarily becauseA. ants would otherwise be unable to tell whether potential mating sites were occupied by related colonies.B.the ability aids in the assignment of specific tracks such as scouting for new nests, among the various members of a nest.C.ants who could not distinguish their own personal pheromones would be unable to tell if they had previously embraced a siteD.pheromone differentiation is essential to account evaluation of potential nesting sites 这个能力对描述可能的巢穴的评估(evaluation)很重要 E. pheromone differentiation is essential to ants’ability to evaluate the size of crevices before entering them 这个能力对蚂蚁在进入缝隙之前评估缝隙的大小很重要 答案：C解析：本题问的是researchers的观点，回原文定位至第四句。该句表明，研究人员认为这些蚂蚁会计算它们两次探索路径之间相交的频率。基于此，可知这些蚂蚁能够区分自己与其他成员间的激素很重要，因为如果它们不能区分的话，它们就不知道自己曾经是否走过这条路，从而就没办法去计算两次路径的相交频率，对应C选项。A选项错，whether从句内容无中生有；B选项错，assignment of specific tracks无中生有；D、E选项中，be essential to均找不到对应。 Which of the following best describe the function of the highlighted portion of the passage?A. lt clarifies the relationship between the scout ants’ behavior and the quality of a potential nesting site.B. It offers a hypothesis to explain why ants make only two trips through each potential nesting siteC. lt attempts to reconcile the behavior of scout ants with the nesting locations eventually chosen by their colonies reconcile v.调和 D. lt challenges the conclusion of researchers about scout ants ‘specific behaviorE. It undermines observations of former experiments about Temnothorax ant’s ability to distinguish pheromones 答案：A解析：句子作用题。由句子中“strongly supports this hypothesis.”可知，这句话是为了支持researcher观点的。A选项It clarifies the relationship正确。B错，offers a hypothesis错误。这个句子里没有hypothesis，而是observation。C错，attempt to reconcile无中生有。DE错，challenge 和undermine无中生有。我发现答案其实并没有纠结具体内容, 而是单纯从句子作用角度出发, 那说实话, 这样想的话, 这个题比较简单

title: GRE填空08
content: 范围大概是张巍1700中section63-70左右的单空题 11.Anthropologist Jane Goodall was___ in her determination to anthropomorphize the animals she observed with such empathy, and so resisted her editors attempt to recast her descriptions in more dispassionate language. A. fickle 易变的；无常的B. stalwart 忠诚的；忠实的C. solicitous 忠诚的,忠实的,坚定的D. pretentious 做作的,自命不凡的E.whimsical empathy 同情, 共鸣 n. dispassionate 不带感情的 解析：so resisted体现了JG的坚定，正确答案选B选项。stalwart坚定的。 翻译：人类学家JG的非常坚定地赋予她用同情观察的动物以人性，而且如此抵制她编辑想要用更加不带感情的语言改写她的描述的企图。 22.Although New York exhilarated him, even at first Leger’s reaction to it was not__: he was initially bothered by its stunning verticality.A. unspontaneousB. unintentionalC. unqualifiedD. unhopefulE. uninterested exhilarate 使高兴, 使振奋 解析：not+空格对应前面的exhilarate取反义，或者可以说not+空格和bothered取同义，所以正确答案选C。unqualified不受限制的。 翻译：尽管纽约让他很兴奋，但在最初Leger对于纽约的反应不是没有限制的：他最初因为纽约惊人的垂直设计感到烦扰。 感受: 这个题还真让我分析对了, 先分析取同还是取反, 然后发现五个选项只有unqualified稍微有点儿沾边, 其他的带进去都和分析的相反, 就选出来了. 31.Discussions of impending water shortages are often couched in apocalyptic rhetoric, yet if the language is somewhat_, the basic message is sound: water is indeed scarce and growing scarcer. A. abstractB. complacentC.ambiguousD. unfamiliarE.overblown coach (用某种文体或方式)表达，措辞 complacent 自满的 解析：同义重复文中的couched in apocalyptic rhetoric，正确答案选E选项。overblown过分的。 翻译：关于即将发生的水资源短缺经常被表达成世界末日一样的夸张，但即使这些话说的有些过分，但基本的信息还是正确的：水资源的确短缺且正在变得更加短缺。 41.The physical layout of the laboratory, although well adapted to the research being pursued when it was built, was not_, making a thorough redesign necessary before a proposed newexperimental program could be undertaken. A.compromisedB. impreciseC.convolutedD.ubiquitousE.plastic 解析：making a thorough redesign necessary说明实验室之前没有改变过，再根据空格前面的not，得出空格选体现改变意思的词，正确答案选E。plastic可塑的，能变化的。 翻译：实验室的物理布局，尽管一开始建造之时能够满足所有研究所需，但不能改造，这使得在一个新的实验项目开始之前制定一个重新设计是完全有必要的。 52.Within the field of emotional intelligence research, disagreements remain about whether emotional intelligence can be learned and strengthened or is____ characteristic. A. an expressedB. an inbornC. an inventedD. a cultivatedE. a perceptible adj.可察觉的,可感知的 解析：此题逻辑非常简单，空格和learned and strengthened取反义词，正确答案选B选项。inborn天生的。 翻译：在情商研究的领域中，关于情商究竟是后天加强学习的还是先天具有的特征仍存在争议。 61.The cognitive flexibility of successful fictional detectives is often____ by their cultural ambivalence: detectives’ intellectual acumen, it seems, exists in direct proportion to their uneasy place in society. A.amplifiedB. highlightedC. spurredD. matchedE. negated negate v.否定 ambivalent （忧喜参半、好坏参半等）矛盾情绪的 acumen 聪明 proportion 比例 72.Barry was a skilled___: though his arguments were completely flawed, they were clever-sounding enough to deceive everyone who heard them. A. sophist 诡辩家B. scholarC. quibbler quibble v.(为小事)计较,斤斤计较,吹毛求疵D. doctrinaireE. pedant deceive v.欺骗

title: 回北邮第二天
content: 有点原形毕露了上午早起复习了一个list.吃饭麦麦没开门, 去了食堂.复习第二个list复习一半拉屎打断了, 然后就…看美女,没忍住.关键是忍的时间耽误了很久,中午报复性做题, 单空题还是做了几个.吃完饭去打游戏, 午休起来又打篮球回来帮妈妈写论文写到19:45, 没饭吃, 跑出去吃饭,打游戏学了1h数学, 好歹把组合C几几搞了, 标准正态分布搞了. 今日账单应该是48.8, 全部用来吃饭, 早饭9 + 午饭18.8 + 晚饭21

title: GRE填空07
content: 1Medieval cathedrals still stand as marvels of architecture, but as far as modern science is concerned, medieval physics and chemistry are simply irrelevant, at best a dead end, at worst the very____of what science is supposed to be. A.exemplarB.glorification 同根词: glory 光荣,赞颂C.reflectionD.dilution 同根词: dilute 稀释,冲淡;削弱E.antithesis marvel 奇迹 解析：at best a dead end说明，at worst要选一个比dead end还要递进的词，所以根据选项选出正确答案E。antithesis对立。 翻译：中世纪大教堂仍是建筑的奇迹，但就现代科学而言，中世纪的物理和化学就是驴唇不对马嘴的了，最好的死胡同，最坏的就被认为是和科学对立。 2For the urban researcher, the long lives of ancient cities can provide ample chronological data,making up for the paucity stemming from relative___of most present-day cities. A.complexityB. formlessness formless 没有固定形状的C. transparencyD. diversityE. youthfulness 解析：空格要填入一个词作为当前城市的历史资料缺乏的原因，能导致这种缺乏的原因是E选项，城市的年轻导致了资料的缺乏。youthfulness年轻。 翻译：对于这个城市研究者，古城的长寿命能够提供丰富的时间资料，这补偿了大多数现在的城市因为相对年轻而引起的资料缺乏。 31.The space travels described in science fiction stories always used to be epic adventures, in comparison to which current journals in space seem quite___ .A. mundaneB. excitingC. dramatic 突然的,巨大的,令人吃惊的D. riskyE. heroic 解析：根据in comparison to得知后面空格和前文的特征取反，前文的特征是“epic史诗般的”，所以正确答案选A选项。mundane平凡的。 翻译：科幻小说中描述的太空旅行曾经总是史诗般的冒险，而现在的太空旅行却看起来很平常。 4To criticize a disaster film for being__is a bit silly, since people do not go to disaster movies to see an honest portrayed of reality. A. expensiveB. harrowing 痛心的,使人十分难过的C. derivative adj.非独创的D. convolutedE. implausible 解析：since people do not go to disaster movies to see an honest portrayed of reality说明“真实”不好，那么这里就不应该批评这部电影的“不真诚”。正确答案选E选项，implausible不合情理的。 翻译：批评灾难片十分不真实是个有点傻的举动，因为人们去看灾难片的时候并不是为了看现实生活中的真实写照。 5In his youth, the naturalist and artist John James Audubon was given to__glamorous tales about himself: he falsely claimed to have studied under a renowned French painter and hinted that he was the heir apparent to the French throne. A.disavowingB. understandingC.constrainingD.obfuscating 使困惑,使模糊E.concocting 编造,调制 glamorous 迷人的 heir apparent renowned 解析：falsely claimed体现了这个人是在编造故事，所以正确答案选E选项。concoct编造。短语be given to 沉迷于… 翻译：在约翰·詹姆斯·奥杜邦年轻的时候，这个博物学家兼画家沉迷于编造关于他自己的令人向往的故事：他虚假地宣称跟一个有名的法国画家学习过，并且暗示说他是法国王位继承人。 62.Holston characterized a colonial situation as an aggregation of activities and a conjunction of outcomes that, though__and at times coordinated, were usually diffuse, disorganized, and even contradictory. A. dubiousB. chaoticC. harmoniousD. linkedE. imputed 常指不公正地把责任等）归咎于 解析：此题有陷阱，根据and前后的并列关系得知空格和coordinated取同，所以很多人就选了C选项。但是注意后面有一个at times，说明coordinated要比空格递进，所以正确答案选一个比coordinated弱一点的词，正确答案选D选项。linked有联系的。 翻译：霍斯顿把殖民局势描绘为活动的集合和结果的结合，尽管互相关联而且有时相互协调，但通常是分散的，无序的，甚至是矛盾的。 7 With the numerous opponents of the controversial new taxation measure in such afury, anyone who publicly advocated the measure did not fail to meet with__usage.A. politic B.severeC.soberD.respectfulE.dejected 82.She constantly_ herself for not living up to her own ideas—for not working hard enough ornot having motives that were pure enough.A. exaltedB. coddled.C.excoriatedvD. mollifiedE.deluded 91.The era’s examples ofthat are cited by the author can be balanced in part by certainexamples of dissent during the same period.A. diversityB. authoritarianismC. forbearanceD.volatilityE.lucidity 10 It seems foolish to refuse the offer of an expedient that is both sosuccess and so difficultto create them absent.A.reminiscent ofB. lacking inC. distinct fromD. indispensable toE. inimical to 111.The stories in Yiyun Li’s recent collection are distinctive particularly for the strong contrastbetween their emotional intensity and their consistently___tone.A.affableB.ebullientC.measuredD. irascibleE.overwrought 122.The paleontologist examined the problem afresh, believing that the accepted classificationthe essential continuity of the specimens by making specious distinctions among them.A. disprovedB. beliedC.conflatedD.divulgedE.relaxed

title: 回北邮了
content: 回北邮了北邮就是适合学习, 今天效率比在油田高了不少, 虽然抖音还是看了不少. 也无意中看了论坛, 24fall的飞榜开了, 突然间了解到很多信息有点儿”猪脑过载”, b站有两个很厉害的up, 很理性信息检索能力很强, 而且愿意分享. tomorrow希望天气好起来, 今天阴郁得厉害. 湿湿的.早起, 7:50吧.午休.开销控制在50元, 我觉得很简单的.点了早饭背30min单词再出去, 吃了早饭, 安顿好了上午浅浅刷题, 就这样吧.刷题 - 复习 - 背新单词 节奏再找一找.今天晚上干一个数学睡觉了.

title: GRE填空06
content: 这个就是自己刷张巍1700上面的6选2和单空,不是雷哥网上的 1Culture, like speech, is primarily a human faculty, although both functions may exist in a more___ form in lesser primates. 让步关系，前面说主要是人类的能力，后文说在一些灵长类动物中也会以一种更加原始的方式出现，也就是说人类和灵长类动物都有文化和演讲，但是灵长类动物的文化和演讲更原始（初级），正确答案选CF选项。primitive原始的，rudimentary原始的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 文化，就像演讲一样，主要是人类的能力，尽管同样的功能能够以一种更原始的形式出现于一小部分灵长类动物中。 A. indispensable adj.不可或缺的,必不可少的B. crucial 至关重要的,关键性的C. primitive 原始的D. intelligibleE. recognizableF. rudimentary 2 Tompkinson’s prior donations to the university, while very generous, failed to ___ the magnitude of her latest gift. 解析：尽管已经很慷慨了，但是没有料到后来更加慷慨的捐赠，弄个对应点在于latest，答案选BD选项。portend预示，predict预言。 翻译：T之前给大学的捐赠，虽然是慷慨，但实际上没能预计到最近她的捐赠的礼物的重量级。 A.compensate forB. portend 预示C.clarifyD.predictE.offsetF.undermine prior 事先的,优先的,之前的 39.The first images of Jupiter’s moon Callisto show bright regions of material, as if older and darker ice had slid downhill and exposed the___ ice underneath. 解析：older and darker ice had slid downhill之后肯定会露出没有被勿扰的ice underneath，所以答案选DF选项。pristine崭新的，原始的，unblemished无瑕疵的。【微信公众号：张巍老师】 翻译：第一张关于火星的卫星的木卫四的照片显示出了材料中的光亮的区域，就像是更苍老更黑暗的冰滑下山坡，并且暴露了底下原始的冰层。 A. ancientB. murky 浑浊的,污浊的c.compact 小型的,紧实的D. pristineE. grimy 沾满污垢的F.unblemished 410.Mortoris is dour and___, seemingly incapable of smiling, let alone laughing. 解析：seemingly incapable of smiling, let alone laughing说明这个人不苟言笑，正确答案选EF选项。lugubrious悲伤的，gloomy阴暗的。 翻译：M是严厉而且阴沉的，看上去不会微笑，更不用说是大笑了。 A. mirthfulB. jovial 欢乐的,愉快的c. intelligentD. tepid 不冷不热的,微微温乎的;不热情的E. lugubriousF. gloomy dour 严厉的,冷酷的 incapable 没有能力的 let alone 更不用说 57.Circulatory systems on organisms originated in widely separated epochs, according to the fossil record,and under a broad range of circumstances, the myriad forms they take attest to that___ of origin. 解析：that同义重复前文的特征widely separated epochs，所以正确答案选DF选项。heterogeneity多样性，diversity差异。 翻译：生物的循环系统从很多分离的时代起源，根据化石记录，还有大量的情况，无数种证明发源地多种多样的方式。 A. mysteriousnessB. randomnessC. ambiguityD. heterogeneity 同根词: heterogeneousE. indeterminacy 同根词: indeterminate 不确定的,模糊的F. diversity myriad 无数,大量 68.Compared to their predecessors, who were more nationalist than feminist in political orientation,Roman women activists of the younger generation are more inclined to___ women’s rights, often creating organizations focused primarily on women’s issues. 解析：often creating organizations focused primarily on women’s issues体现这些人愿意为女性争取权利，所以正确答案选CF选项。champion捍卫，defend保护。 翻译：和他们的前辈，那些在政治方向上更加民族主义而非女性主义的人们进行比较，年轻的一代的罗马女性激进分子更加倾向于为女权而奋斗，经常创造出一些主要关注于女性问题的机构。 A.expandB. de-emphasize 不予强调C.championD. idealizeE.downplayF. defend 7Individuals, governments, and companies show ample ability to __ themselves by setting goals based on current conditions and then blindly following them even when those conditions change drastically. 解析：then blindly following中的blindly体现了个人，政府和公司会对它们自己造成不好的东西，所以正确答案选AE选项。hamstring使衰弱，impair损害。 翻译：个人，政府，还有公司展示出了大量的能力来损害他们自己，通过根据现在的状态建立一些目标然后盲目的追随这些目标，甚至是当这些情况已经彻底改变也是一样坚持。 A. hamstring v.妨碍,使不能正常工作; n.腘绳肌腱B. reinvent 彻底改造,以新的形象示人C. promoteD. revitalize 使康复,使恢复生机E. impairF. invigorate 使生机勃勃,使精神焕发 810.The performer can be____ in his comedy, but he is fundamentally a bighearted person who displays a core sweetness even at his most manic. 解析：even at his most manic说明表演者是能够引起他的manic特征的，所以正确答案选AF选项。inflammatory煽动性的，provocative挑衅的。 翻译：这个表演者在他的戏剧中十分激动，但他根本上是一个内心明亮的人，一个就算是在狂躁的时候也能展现出内心的善良。 A. inflammatory 煽动性的B. pedestrianC. gloomyD. uninspiredE. puerile 幼稚的F. provocative manic 狂躁的,狂热的

title: GRE填空05
content: test 021The problem a generation ago was not the new art itself but the heightened intensity of conviction surrounding it, which is thankfully absent in our wonderfully __________ times. A. fervid B. impassioned C. undogmatic D. receptive E. nostalgic F. optimistic conviction 除了 定罪 还有 坚信,深信 的意思 fervid 强烈的, 热烈的 impassioned 充满激情的,热烈的 一代人之前的问题不是由艺术品本身产生的, 而是由围绕在它周围的坚定的信仰产生的, 好在现在这个美好的 不教条的,接受的 时代, 这种坚信缺席了. 2Given that the department director was such a feeble contributor, sitting silently at important policy meetings and usually deferring to low-level aides, it was surprising that he had such a reputation for __________. A. magnanimity B. perspicacity C. impartiality D. detachment E. benevolence F. discernment feeble 虚弱的, 衰弱的 defer to sb. 遵从,听从,顺从 perspicacious 有洞察力的 discern 察觉出,分辨出 detachment 公正,客观 impartial 公正的, 不偏不倚的 3Although torrential rains can sometimes be highly destructive, human survival generally proves much more __________ without rain than during periods of its overabundance. A. ponderous B. unmanageable C. onerous D. tedious E. arduous F. unlikely torrent n.激流,急流,狂潮 ponderous adj.笨重的,缓慢的 onerous adj.费劲的 arduous adj.艰难的 意思是: 尽管大雨有时很具有破坏性, 但是幸存下来的人们都说, 有些(由大雨引起的)困难比发大水的时候更加费劲. 4Consolidating a memory is not instantaneous or even __________: every memory must be encoded and moved from short-term to long-term storage, and some of those memories are, for whatever reason, more vividly imprinted than others. A.salutaryB.deliberateC.sequentialD.momentaryE.Inevitable salutary 有益的 同根词: consolidate v.使巩固,使加强 imprint v.刻上记号,铭记【过往命中时间】2023年03月11日中国线上；2022年08月15日中国线上；2021.08.20中国陆线下；2020-09-11，2017-08-25, 2018-09-07, 2018-07-05, 2018-06-07，2021年09月01日中国线上【答案】E【解析】思路一：or在并列否定句时，not是在or前后共用的，所以第一句话的完整内容应该是：consolidating memory is not instantaneous or even 【not】 ___ , 冒号后面是解释内容，every memory must be encoded and moved from short-term to long-term storage体现的是consolidating需要一个过程，对应not instantaneous, 第二句话some of these memories are, for whatever reason, more vividly imprinted than others体现some 能记住，other不一定能记住，所以是not inevitable(并不是每一段记忆 都会被巩固)。思路二：否定递进是弱递进，所以这里的逻辑是“不是立即发生，甚至都不是一定发生的”，所以正确答案选 E 选项。inevitable 必然的。【句子翻译】巩固记忆不是瞬间发生的甚至都不是一定会发生的：每一个记忆必须被编码而且从短期变成长期的储存，而且一些记忆，出于某些原因，比其他记忆铭刻得更加清晰。 5The argument, while important, combines analysis and __________, swinging in tone from patient consideration to bitter invective. A. introspectionB. prevaricationC. facetiousnessD. idealismE. Polemic swing v.摇摆 n.秋千 bitter adj.激烈的,苦的 invective n.咒骂,谩骂 introspect v.内省,反省 prevaricate v.支支吾吾,搪塞,闪烁其词 facetious adj.(在不当的场合)开玩笑的; 滑稽的; 轻浮的 polemic n.激烈争论,论战,辩论术 逗号前后取同，空格对应bitter invective取同，选择E。 6Gutierrez is the only one who seems to be (i)__________ the controversy sparked by his article: his appetite for scientific (ⅱ)__________ seems, if anything, to be increasing with age. relishingquellingwhitewashing altercationsconundrumsbreakthroughs quell v.镇压,平息;消除,缓解 whitewash v.粉饰,掩饰;在体育比赛中接连击败对手的）全胜，完胜 altercation n.吵嘴,争吵 conundrum n.令人迷惑的难题 古铁雷斯似乎是唯一一个喜欢他的文章引发的争议的人:如果有什么不同的话，他对科学难题的兴趣似乎随着年龄的增长而增加。 altercation是口角，激烈的争吵的意思，G享受争议，是因为他喜欢科学的难题，并不是说他喜欢在科学问题上与别的观点争吵。 7Although it is quite probable that many small asteroids in the solar system’s asteroid belt have (i), the total mass of these objects cannot be (ⅱ), since the combined gravitational pull of all known asteroids is (ⅲ)____ to fully account for the asteroid belt’s effect on the motion of nearby planets such as Mars. similar structuresformed by accretionescaped detection diminishingestimatedsubstantial sufficientunlikelyrequired mass n.质量(重量) asteroid n.小行星 diminish v.减少,减弱 同根词: dim accretion n.堆积,堆积层【解析】此题偏难，三空都有一定的联动关系，these objects指代前文提到的many small asteroids，整体逻辑是：虽然很多小行星没有被探测到，但是【这些被漏掉的小行星】总质量不会很大，因为已知部分的总引力已经足以解释整个行星带对附近的影响。【即已知的量和真实的量相差不大→没有被探测到的量很小】【句子翻译】虽然很有可能太阳系行星带里还有很多小行星没有被探测到，但是这些小行星的总质量不会很大。因为(目前)所有已知的小行星的总引力足以解释小行星带对附近行星(比如火星)运动产生的影响。 8Our contemporary preference for natural expression over artifice is (i)________ the traditional Western view that the skill with which you expressed a position corresponded closely to the credibility of your argument. Rhetorical styles might vary, but style itself was never a matter of (ⅱ). And“style”was not just a well-turned sentence: poor expression, it was believed, (ⅲ) poor thought.A.a departure fromB.a reflection onC.an endorsement of D.substanceE.indifferenceF.intention G.amelioratedH.elevatedI.betrayed endorse v.公开支持,赞同第一句话主要说的是当代人喜欢无技巧的自然表达（Our contemporary preference for natural expression over artifice）；而传统西方的观点是表达技巧很重要（traditional Western view that the skill of your argument）。这两种观点是对立的，第一空答案选择A. a departure form 远离，脱离。but表示转折，but前说修辞手法会改变（vary），but后转折取反选择E indifference。表达风格本身永远不会是无关紧要的，这里的a matter of indifference 是无关紧要的意思。最后我们看三空，冒号解释说明。冒号前说style不仅仅是一个华丽的句子，那么冒号后表示匮乏的表达也反应了匮乏的思想，所以第三空答案选择I betray “表明”的意思句子翻译: 我们当代对自然表达的偏好超过了技巧，这背离了传统的西方观点，即你表达立场的技巧与你的论点的可信度密切相关。修辞风格可能会有所不同，但风格本身从来都不是无关紧要的。而且“风格”不仅仅是一句得体的句子:人们相信，拙劣的表达暴露了拙劣的思想。

title: 离开油田,去向节点
content: 离开油田,像往常一样…今天是2024年2月17日, 明天的火车, 回北京了. 好像和往常一样, 寒假见了很多同学, 吃了很多好吃的妈妈做的健康的饭, 跟老爹依然很不对付, 但是无论多么不喜欢油田现在这个时间多少有点儿伤感. 莫名其妙的. 去向节点,看来应该是有点儿不一样…备考GRE是我最不自律的一次, 这个寒假不知为啥, 除了学GRE, 我好像什么都能做的进去, 打了游戏, 去看了CBA, 去了市里, 搭了博客, 打球, 见朋友, 被抖音占去大量时间, 总之学GRE的时间莫名其妙的从我指缝溜走, 我希望去学校之后能有所好转, 但是真的能吗? 见了很多同学, 真的, 特别多, 但是这次去过之后, 曾经的同学少年, 真的就都多多少少要进入社会了, 研究生也是工作嘛毕竟. 然后我就感觉我还是像个傻子一样, 被保护的很好, 傲然说的对, 而且我心思很少, 就是简简单单的, 梦想也就是简简单单的美好. 但是这梦想真的是通过努力能实现的吗, 或者说我现在真的努力嘛? 我深知其实大三下相当关键, 无论是申请出国还是国内保研, 而这两方面我都不能算有完全的把握. 而且我也知道GRE如果三月份考不下来会稍微不太舒服, 但是, 现在只能是”但行好事,莫问前程” 治愈自己的规划与幻想 GRE的学习能够量化最好, 我觉得还是用结果来量化我今天学了张巍等价词两个List 完全投入大概是1h, 差不多一天过3个是合理的. 填空做题 阅读做题 数学做题 还有 抖词的单词 还有 作文 这个能量化, 看抖音的时间 <= 1h 打游戏的时间, <= 2h 邓思阳说每天学习8h强度很大了, 我想想 如果能早起播1h单词 这就有1h 如果上午能做题一组+迅速总结, 这就差不多2h, 不过可能弄不完 如果下午午休结束能阅读 + 总结, 这就有2h 晚上如果再能弄弄数学作文, 临睡觉背背单词, 这就2 + 1, 一共8小时. 理论成立 明天咋安排? 车上背GRE等价词两个List. 下午有空做做阅读. 晚上数学 + 作文 + 单词 12:00前睡, 每天都一样. 笨人,咸鱼,有笨人的活法笨, 其实是简单, 我的世界就是很简单, 逻辑也很简单, 事情的运行方式也很简单. 真实的世界很复杂, 所以我们少做, 少承担风险, 承担风险很帅, 但是我们要苟, 不用太帅.攒钱记账要开始.练球要开始.早起早睡要开始.

title: GRE填空04
content: test011One thing both authors have in common is a striking amount of _____: they claim to know how massive institutions, some of them richly endowed, all of them central to American society and culture, should be reshaped.A hubrisB proprietyC biasD prescienceE indolence 【过往命中时间】2022年08月11日中国线上；【答案】A【解析】冒号后面的内容说他们说话有种夸大的感觉，能对应这种特征的只能是 A 选项。hubris 傲慢自大。【句子翻译】极其自命清高是每个作家都具有的共同特点，他们声称知道那些处于美国文化社会中心的，拥有得天独厚资源的庞大机构应该如何重塑。【选项释义】hubris 傲慢propriety 得体的举止,礼仪 n.bias 偏见prescience 预知indolence 懒惰 n. indolent 懒惰的 endow v.(向学校等机构)捐钱; be endowed with sth. 天生赋予,生来就有(某种品质) 2Although the essayist`s arguments did not _____ her most perceptive readers, the extreme subtlety of the points she made explains why she was misinterpreted by most critics of her day.A convinceB confoundC entertainD persuadeE perplexF enlighten 【过往命中时间】2024年02月01日中国线上；2023年05月06日北美线上；2019-08-31【答案】B E【解析】让步关系虽然这个作者的论点没有_______ 她大部分的有洞察力的读者，极度难懂的笔触解释了为什么她被同时代大部分的批评家误解。后半句——误解，前半句——没误解，选BE,使困惑【句子翻译】尽管这个作者的议论并没有让她最敏锐的读者感到困惑，但她描绘出的极端难懂的内容解释了她为什么被她同时期大部分文学评论家所误解。【选项释义】A. convince 使信服B. confound 使迷惑C. entertain 娱乐D. persuade 劝说E. perplex 使困惑F. enlighten v.启发,开导 3One of the vocalists who auditioned for a leading part in the local production of Sweeney Todd seemed to prefer _____ to any attempt at producing a melody; a more unpleasant voice was hard to imagine. A. warbling B. imitating C. improvising D. shrieking E. crooning F. Caterwauling 【过往命中时间】2020-09-11，2017-05-21,【答案】D F【解析】a more unpleasant voice was hard to imagine 的意思是“很难想想一个更难听的声音了”，所以空格要选体现不好听的特征，正确答案选 DF 选项。shrieking 尖叫，caterwauling 尖叫。【句子翻译】一位来竞争本地剧作《理发师陶德》主演的歌手，一张嘴就开始嚎叫，很难比这唱得更难听了。【选项释义】A. warble v.鸟啭,用颤音唱B. imitating 模仿C. improvisingD. shriek 尖叫E. croon 低声歌唱F. caterwaul (像猫一样)嚎叫 audition n.v.试唱,试音,试演 vocalist 歌手,声乐家 vocal 嗓音的,声音的;直言不讳的 improvise 即兴创作,临时做 4Though humanitarian emergencies are frequent features of television news, such exposure seldom________ the public, which rather seems resigned to a sense of impotency. A.paralyzesB.demoralizesC.assuagesD.galvanizesE.exasperates 【过往命中时间】 2021年11月07日中国线下；2021年10月10日中国线下；2019-10-20, 2017-04-14,【答案】D【解析】which rather seems resigned to a sense of impotency 说明 seldom+ 空格=resigned，所以空格选 resigned 的反义，正确答案选 D 选项。galvanize激励。【句子翻译】尽管新闻报道中的人道主义危机是时常发生的，这样的曝光很少刺激公众，反而有种看似无力的感觉。【选项释义】A. paralyzes v.使瘫痪,使麻痹B. demoralizes 使泄气,使士气低落 morale 士气C. assuages 平息,缓和D. galvanizes 刺激E. exasperates 激怒 feature （报章、电视等的）特写，专题节目 resign v.辞职 impotent adj.无力的,阳痿的 5Museum re-creations of seventeenth-century New England interiors reflect the assumption that Puritan culture was__________: the room are sparsely furnished, sparely decorated, and dimly lighted. A.industriousB.profligateC.garishD.credulousE.Austere sparse 稀少的 garish 花哨的 credulous 轻信的,易受骗的 6Weeds lack the lethality of insects and microbes, which can strike farm crops seemingly out of nowhere and rapidly wipe them out. It is worth bearing in mind, however, that infestations of insects and disease are typically (i)_________ events, whereas weeds are(ii)_________. A.sporadicB.devastatingC.intractable D.resilientE.controllableF.ubiquitous 选 AF lethal 致命的,致死的 lethality n.致命 weed 杂草 sporadic 不经常发生的,偶尔发生的 resilient 可迅速恢复的,有弹性的 devastate 毁灭,彻底破坏 intractable 难对付的 7To avoid being brought down by the financial scandal that rocked the government, Jackson sought to (i)__herself. Along with her staff, she prepared and issued carefully worded statements admitting and detailing her involvement in the financial dealings at issue but claiming that this involvement was entirely (ii). exculpatecelebratedistract pecuniaryfabricatedunwitting sought – seek celebrate v.庆祝 fabricate v.捏造,编造 unwitting adj.不知情的,无意的,糊里糊涂地 witless adj.愚蠢的,傻的 8Observations from the Chandra X-ray Observatory give astronomers even more evidence that galaxies (i)__________ and that even their central supermassive black holes eventually (ⅱ)__________. swellcoalesceendure mergeimplodedeteriorate 答案是: coalesce merge swell v.膨胀,肿胀;增加,增大 coalesce v.合并,汇聚 endure v.持续;忍受,忍耐 implode v.向内聚爆 9Cole makes the argument that while some advocates of government transparency seem to treat any exposure of state secrets as an (i)_, that position is(ii)____ ;there are many legitimate bases for(iii)_________ disclosures, Cole contends, particularly when they reveal the identities of sources and methods of foreign intelligence. abuse of powerambiguous artunmitigated good untenableunderstandablecommonplace condemningcondoningextolling 科尔认为，虽然一些提倡政府透明的人似乎把任何国家机密的曝光都视为一件好事，但这种立场是站不住脚的;科尔认为，谴责披露有许多合理的依据，尤其是当它们暴露了外国情报来源和方法的身份时。选: unmitigated good, untenable, condemning advocate v.提倡; n.提倡者 transparency 透明 unmitigated 完全的,十足的,彻底的 —- mitigate v.缓和,减轻 extol v.赞美 condone v.宽恕,纵容 intelligence n.情报 10The Holy People in Navajo sacred narratives do not act as moral __________: when they teach, it is as often by what they do wrong as by what they do right. A. agents B. arbiters C. defenders D. paragons E. ethicists F. Exemplars 在纳瓦霍人的神圣叙事中，圣人并没有扮演道德模范的角色:当他们教导时，他们做错的事情和做对的事情一样多选 DF narrative n.叙述,讲故事 agent n.代理人, 经纪人 ethicist n.伦理学家 ethic n.伦理,道德 arbiter 仲裁者,决定者,裁决者 arbitrary 任意的,武断的,专断的
